concept.title: Common Takeoff Errors
concept.shortdesc: A list of common errors that are made during takeoff.

conbody.p: Failure to keep the airplane straight ahead. Unfamiliarity with the airplane and uneven power application cause this. Remember, there are two large rudders. It takes considerable foot pressure to control them on takeoff.

ul.li: Jockeying or blasting the throttles to maintain directional control.
Using brakes to steer the plane
Instrument flying instead of contact flying
Failure to level off after takeoff
Failure to correct properly for drift
